Money Management

If you are like me, who is just started with your Career. Its crucial to understand the power of Money management. I am not claiming myself as a Financial advisor 😝. There are many advisors out there, they might be able to help you more than I could.

But, there are certain things, I have been taught about Money management

  • You couldn’t (Ponadhuku apro kanaku poduradhu waste)

So with that being said, you should know where I am going with, Everyone should know where are they getting money from, where are they spending the most and the least, etc…

Basically one should know in and out of all their money endpoints and some necessary analysis out of it, to easily manage it.

My Experience

Starting off with my own Personal experience. If you are thinking of something which has lines and rows (nope not notebooks😞), you are right. I did start using excel initially. Obviously, it works great for most of the people around me, Unfortunately not for me 🫠

It was such a pain to collate the transactions and maintain that in a structured form in Excel. At the end of the day, I couldn’t easily find out where the in and out of Money endpoints thereby defeating the whole point of maintaining it.

Firefly III

Firefly is free and open source personal finance manager.

Features

  1. Budget
  2. Bills
  3. Piggy Bank
  4. Reports
  5. Rules
  6. Recurring Transactions
  7. Much more …

Code

```javascript
function sayHello(name) {

    console.log('Hello World');
  } else {
    console.log(`Hello ${name}`);
  }
}
```
